image.altText: Richard Harris and Craig Challen, standing outside wearing their medals, smile.

props.synopsis: South Australian anaesthetist Dr Richard Harris, who rose to fame after he helped rescue 12 children trapped in a cave in Thailand, will be sworn into the role next month.

title.children: Thai cave rescue hero appointed South Australia's Lieutenant Governor

image.altText: Three people standing at beach

props.synopsis: Issac McGair has had a rough few months of recovery after a serious accident in Adelaide's Murrayland in October last year.

title.children: Teen who spent months in hospital after horrific water accident warns others

image.altText: A sign on the Bruce Highway around Townsville, taken shortly after 1pm on Thursday.

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Kirrily is picking up speed and intensity at it heads towards the Queensland coast. Schools are closed, flights have been cancelled and residents have been told to stay indoors. Follow live.

title.children: Gale-force winds and rain impacting north Queensland as Cyclone Kirrily strengthens to category three

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Cyclone Kirrily intensifies into a severe category three system, BOM says
'Not the time to be going to the shops': Deadline to take shelter and clear roads

image.altText: Boating equipment is stacked up on a Townsville beach

props.synopsis: Tropical Cyclone Kirrily's irregular shape will alter hazards to the north and south as it nears the north Queensland coastline.

title.children: Cyclone Kirrily is not your usual cyclone. This is why it's different

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks in a courtyard at Parliament House

props.synopsis: The prime minister has defended changes to the stage 3 tax cuts, saying the government made its decision to overhaul the system as a way to ease cost-of-living pressures on Australians.

title.children: Could the crossbench and the Coalition stand in the way of Albanese's tax cut overhaul?

image.altText: a screen shows a calculator that can assist people to understand how tax cuts will affect them.

props.synopsis: Want to know how the federal government's planned changes to the final stage of tax cuts will affect you? Use our tax cut calculator to find out.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cuts calculator: See how the changes will affect you

image.altText: A man walking into court

props.synopsis: Stewart Johnston, who helped expose the Oakden abuse scandal, pleads guilty to a charge of possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: Oakden campaigner Stewart Johnston pleads guilty to possessing child abuse material

image.altText: Nancy Bates looks.

props.synopsis: First Nations singer-songwriter Nancy Bates teaches inmates at the Adelaide Women's Prison how to write songs, sing and play the ukulele in what she hopes will prevent them from reoffending.

title.children: Singer-songwriter helps female prisoners through 'life changing' music program

image.altText: Steven Marshall smiles.

props.synopsis: Former SA premier Steven Marshall broke a painful 20-year election drought for the Liberals. But his government was ousted after a term, following controversies and a tough health focused election campaign from Labor.

title.children: Steven Marshall led the SA Liberals out of the political wilderness, but his government lasted just one term

image.altText: Sunset at the beach at Ceduna.

props.synopsis: The small population of Ceduna may be located on the edge of the Nullarbor and be eight hours drive from the nearest capital city, but it offers the second most affordable beachside suburb in the country and those seeking a sea change aren't hesitating.

title.children: SA the most affordable state for beachside living as pandemic-sparked urban exodus continues

image.altText: People getting off a seaplane in the ocean

props.synopsis: NSW Police says one of the eight occupants had minor injuries and was treated at the scene by NSW Ambulance paramedics.

title.children: 'Could have been worse': Passengers escape after seaplane crashes into Sydney Harbour

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Two doubles players celebrate a point

props.synopsis: Matt Ebden is through to a men's doubles final on Day 12, now it's time to see if Storm Hunter can join him in the women's doubles draw — later we will find out who makes it into the women's singles decider, with Coco Gauff facing Aryna Sabalenka in the marquee match-up. Follow live.

title.children: Matt Ebden has early doubles success on day 12 — can Storm Hunter match him at Melbourne Park?

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Hunter and Siniakova level the match at 1-1
Hsieh Su-Wei and Elise Mertens take the first set
Ebden and Bopanna speak after their win

image.altText: The bronze feet of a vandalised statue.

props.synopsis: Police in Melbourne investigate after a metal statue of Captain Cook was sawn off at the ankles and red paint was daubed over a monument to Queen Victoria.

title.children: Melbourne Captain Cook statue sawn off at ankles, Queen Victoria monument defaced

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: Dylan Lloyd faces the Adelaide Magistrates Court charged with indecently assaulting a woman in Adelaide’s south in July, after being re-arrested earlier on Wednesday.

title.children: Accused child sex offender faces court on separate indecent assault charge

image.altText: A fair-skinned brunette woman, Kerry, kneels beside green and white hives in full sun.

props.synopsis: Several beekeepers in South Australia's Riverland are calling for greater transparency on the potential harm of the state's fruit fly chemical sprays.

title.children: Mysterious bee deaths prompt beekeepers to get answers about the impact of fruit fly chemical sprays

image.altText: Tropical Cyclone Track Map showing weather system approaching queensland coast

props.synopsis: Hundreds of emergency service personnel are poised to respond in Far North Queensland as Tropical Cyclone Kirrily is upgraded to a category three system.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Kirrily upgraded to category three, as at-risk residents urged to move to evacuation centres

image.altText: A beach with a keep clear sign

props.synopsis: A woman in her 20s dies in hospital, taking the death toll from Wednesday's drowning tragedy at Phillip Island to four.

title.children: Victorian beach drowning death toll rises to four after woman dies in hospital

image.altText: public housing towers can be seen from the aerial view

props.synopsis: Residents at Victoria's public housing towers have filed a class action over the state governments plan to knock down and rebuild the structures.

title.children: Residents sue the Victorian government over public housing demolition plans

image.altText: Mitch Starc holds up a clenched fist

props.synopsis: Mitch Starc has become the fifth Australian to take 350 Test wickets as Australia dominates the first session of the second Test against the West Indies at the Gabba. Follow live.

title.children: Australia rips through West Indies' top order in the opening session at the Gabba

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: EDGED AND GONE! Athanaze is caught by Carey, Starc has 350 Test wickets
THAT'S OUT! Chanderpaul edges Starc to Smith and must go!
EDGED! GOT HIM! BRATHWAITE IS OUT!

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios smiles while holding a microphone on court before interviewing a player at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: The prospect of Nick Kyrgios retiring young has never felt more real. As his commentary career blossoms and his injury lay-off grows longer, Australia's most controversial player must make his final choice.

title.children: With a new life beckoning, Nick Kyrgios faces the ultimate decision of his tennis career

image.altText: A smiling young man with neat, dark hair.

props.synopsis: Seven hundred people attended the funeral and hundreds more watched online as the Box Hill GP was laid to rest after his alleged murder earlier this month.

title.children: 'Ripped away from us': Hundreds gather to farewell slain Victorian doctor Ash Gordon

image.altText: A man in an orange tie and a black and white suit stands at a podium.

props.synopsis: The government will halve the stage 3 tax cuts for the highest earners and use the money to deliver an extra $804 to most taxpayers.

title.children: Key takeaways from the prime minister's National Press Club address — as it happened

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a red shirt

props.synopsis: The federal government's move to halve the stage 3 tax cuts for higher earners and instead prioritise relief across the board has been described as both "good government" and an "unbelievable" broken promise.

title.children: We went to Albanese's Sydney electorate for reaction to his tax cuts. Here's what people think

image.altText: A bed with straps inside an execution chamber

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court denies convicted murderer Kenneth Smith's request to stay his execution by nitrogen gas, the nation's first execution using the method which is scheduled for Thursday.

title.children: Court declines to halt first execution by nitrogen gas of inmate in Alabama

image.altText: A black and white picture of a young Melanie taken in 1974, smiling, long hair, vest

props.synopsis: Born Melanie Safka, the folk singer performed to hundreds of thousands of people at the Woodstock music festival in the late 1960s.

title.children: Melanie, who performed at Woodstock in 1969 and was sampled by the Hilltop Hoods, has died

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone in front of US flags. He has an unhappy expression.

props.synopsis: Nikki Haley proved no real threat to Donald Trump in the New Hampshire primary, but her strategy highlighted some of his vulnerabilities before his likely rematch with Joe Biden, writes North America correspondent Carrington Clarke.

title.children: Trump followed a victory with vitriol after his rival exposed his vulnerabilities

image.altText: A screen shot of the leaked document sits beside an image of Debbie Ngarewa-Packer a co-leader of the Maori Party

props.synopsis: As a minor party in New Zealand's governing coalition pushes ahead with a plan to draft a controversial bill on the country's founding documents, Māori leaders have issued a warning.

title.children: A leaked memo, legal battles and a call-to-action from the Māori king — NZ is on edge

image.altText: A middle-aged woman with curly hair sits in the back of a car on a neon-lit street.

props.synopsis: The real-life son of the late cartel boss filed a lawsuit against Netflix last week over the upcoming miniseries about his mother's life.

title.children: Sofia Vergara is unrecognisable as the 'Queen of Cocaine' in Netflix miniseries Griselda

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

props.synopsis: Between $7 billion and $11 billion of the nation’s cash is being used in the shadow economy to fund tax avoidance or other illegal purposes such as buying illicit drugs, according to the Reserve Bank. The news comes after the Australian stock market rose for a fifth consecutive day, hitting a three-week high before the Australia Day long weekend

title.children: As it happened: Australians are hoarding cash and so are criminals, says RBA

image.altText: Creative Kate Berry sits on a single bed in a muted motel room and smiles, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Kate Berry has juggled many jobs, from photography to founding a food and parenting magazine. The pandemic helped her reassess her relationship to work.

title.children: How single-tasking helps Kate Berry stay focused and take time out

image.altText: Russian plane

props.synopsis: Ukraine has neither confirmed nor denied Russia's accusation that it deliberately shot down a plane carrying 65 prisoners of war. Here's what we know.

title.children: Ukraine says Russia 'playing with lives' of Ukraine POWs after plane crash. Here's what we know so far

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Palestinians look at a mosque destroyed in an Israeli strike in Rafah.

props.synopsis: Israel denies responsibility after shells fired from tanks struck a huge United Nations compound sheltering displaced Palestinians in Khan Younis, killing at least nine people.

title.children: Rare condemnation from US as tank shells hit UN training centre in Khan Younis

props.synopsis: Scientists have carried out the first successful embryo transfer in a southern white rhino using a method that could pave the way to saving its critically endangered northern cousin from extinction.

title.children: With just two northern white rhinos left, this IVF pregnancy could save them from extinction
